intro: Gonolobus billbergianus, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rapid growth and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
